meanings.definition: A device or organism that can make copies of itself.
meanings.sent1: The tiny replicator in the cell was able to create exact copies of itself.
meanings.sent2: The 3D printer is a replicator that can produce multiple copies of the same object.
meanings.sent3: The replicator at the party kept making more and more cake slices, much to everyone's delight.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a replicator, constantly generating new ideas and projects.
meanings.sent5: The replicator in the sci-fi movie was a terrifying machine that duplicated everything in its path.

meanings.definition: A machine or system that reproduces objects or data.
meanings.sent1: The replicator in the office was used to duplicate important documents.
meanings.sent2: The assembly line is a replicator that mass-produces cars.
meanings.sent3: The replicator in the game malfunctioned, creating endless clones of the main character.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a replicator of information, storing and retrieving data effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The replicator in the lab was a groundbreaking invention that revolutionized data storage.
